articles.title: Left behind by migrant husbands, women break the rules and go to work
articles.description: Years had passed since her husband had crossed the sea to look for work in Europe. Left behind, Khadijah Diagouraga trudged to the couple’s peanut fields alone every day, struggling to earn enough to provide for an extended family of 13.
articles.content: When the towns water pump broke and her faucet went dry, she tied a donkey to a cart to haul water from a nearby well, cursing her absent husband the whole way. Her action shocked this small, conservative village in rural Senegal. Guiding animals was mens wor… [+5795 chars]

articles.author: The New York Times News Service Syndicate
articles.title: Behind the Ukraine aid freeze: 84 days of conflict and confusion
articles.description: Deep into a long flight to Japan aboard Air Force One with President Donald Trump, Mick Mulvaney, the acting White House chief of staff, dashed off an email to an aide back in Washington.
articles.content:
WASHINGTON — Deep into a long flight to Japan aboard Air Force One with President Donald Trump, Mick Mulvaney, the acting White House chief of staff, dashed off an email to an aide back in Washington.
Im just trying to tie up some loose ends, Mulvaney wrote.… [+24711 chars]

articles.author: Charles M. Blow
articles.title: The Decade We Changed Our Minds
articles.description: America in the 2010s saw significant cultural and political shifts that pushed us forward.
articles.content: In 2010, for the first time, Americans acceptance of gay relations crossed the 50 percent mark. Now that number is well into the 70s. Over the same period, acceptance of same-sex marriage went from the 40s to the 60s. Acceptance of gay adoption went from belo… [+2382 chars]

articles.author: Bill Pennington
articles.title: Eagles Overwhelm Giants to Clinch a Playoff Berth
articles.description: Philadelphia and a healthy contingent of its fans ended the Giants’ season — and perhaps Eli Manning’s career — with a dominant second half.
articles.content: The good vibes for the Giants, however, were mostly contained to the third quarter. Trailing by 20-17 after a 50-yard Jake Elliott field goal, Jones had a low shotgun snap bounce off his hands deep in his own territory. Jones, who had been harassed in the pas… [+2283 chars]

articles.author: Emily Cochrane
articles.title: John Lewis, Congressman and Civil Rights Icon, Has Pancreatic Cancer
articles.description: Mr. Lewis said he had Stage 4 pancreatic cancer, but would return to Washington to continue work and begin treatment.
articles.content:
Mr. Lewis said that doctors determined he had the cancer during a routine medical visit this month and that subsequent tests confirmed the diagnosis. His treatment plan will continue for several weeks. 
I may miss a few votes during this period, but with God… [+772 chars]

articles.author: Shauntel Lowe
articles.title: The Best N.B.A. Season of the Decade? Too Hard to Choose
articles.description: Linsanity, LeBron James’s reunion with Cleveland and “The Block” are some of the many extraordinary memories basketball fans took from the past 10 years.
articles.content:
Marc Stein
Hall of Fame sports reporter

articles.author: Katherine Stewart and Caroline Fredrickson
articles.title: Bill Barr Thinks America Is Going to Hell
articles.description: And he’s on a mission to use the “authority” of the executive branch to stop it.
articles.content: Mr. Barr has a long history of supporting just this type of religious liberty. At Notre Dame, he compared alleged violations of religious liberty with Roman emperors forcing Christian subjects to partake in pagan sacrifices. The law is being used as a batteri… [+3317 chars]
